dialog.text: Why does my shadow feel like an enemy instead of part of me?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: vulnerable, curious; Intonation: rising question at end; Speed: moderate; Tone: youthful, earnest; Whispering: none

dialog.text: Because you've been taught to hide the parts that hurt. The shadow only becomes a monster when it's kept in the dark.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: calm, warm; Intonation: steady, reassuring; Speed: slow; Tone: wise, soft; Impression: like a steady firelight guiding; Whispering: light

dialog.text: How do I stop being afraid of it? I'm tired of carrying guilt and anger.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: weary, hopeful; Intonation: tentative; Speed: slightly slower; Tone: small, honest; Whispering: slight when 'tired'

dialog.text: You don't defeat it by force. You invite it to sit with you. Name the feeling, feel it fully for a moment, and you'll find a teacher where you expected a tyrant.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: gentle, instructive; Intonation: calm, encouraging; Speed: measured; Tone: compassionate mentor; Impression: calm bedside manner; Whispering: none

dialog.text: What if I forget? What if I break?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: fearful, fragile; Intonation: quick, worried; Speed: quickened; Tone: childlike honesty; Whispering: a little on 'break'

dialog.text: You won't break — you'll break open. Inner work is practice: small breaths, honest questions, and choosing compassion instead of judgment. Each time you welcome a wound, it loosens its hold.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: soothing, confident; Intonation: steady with gentle uplift on 'open'; Speed: slow and rhythmic; Tone: steady reassurance; Impression: teacher who has walked the path; Whispering: none

dialog.text: Can I really be happy by doing this? Or is happiness something I have to find outside?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: curious, tentative; Intonation: hopeful; Speed: moderate; Tone: searching; Whispering: none

dialog.text: Happiness isn't a prize won by arriving somewhere else. It's a landscape revealed when you stop blaming the world and heal the maps inside you. Freedom grows where you own your reactions.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: clear, uplifting; Intonation: steady then rising on 'inside you'; Speed: measured; Tone: clarifying and warm; Impression: voice of awakening; Whispering: none

dialog.text: Okay. I will try — I'll sit with the hurt, listen, and stop running.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: resolved, softer; Intonation: calm, steady; Speed: measured; Tone: hopeful, sincere; Whispering: gentle on 'listen'

dialog.text: Remember: the shadow is part of your story, not your sentence. Practice each day — one minute of presence, name the feeling, say a soft 'I see you.' Watch the monster become a mirror.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: compassionate, firm; Intonation: clear, rhythmic; Speed: steady; Tone: guiding, uplifting; Impression: sage giving a daily tool; Whispering: none

dialog.text: Try this today: sit for one minute with a difficult feeling and name it. If you feel safe, share what you noticed in the comments — your small courage might invite someone else to begin their inner journey.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: encouraging, warm; Intonation: inviting, hopeful; Speed: moderate; Tone: call to action, gentle urgency; Impression: kindly mentor encouraging community; Whispering: none
